Summer 2025 internships are now open to Finance and Accounting majors! ðŸ“¢ If you visit any BIG4 website, JP Morgan, Bank of America, etc., many have started to open up their intership positions for Summer 2025. If you are a freshman, sophomore, or junior, I recommend starting to apply now. Here are some tips I used to secure my internships a year and a half before the start date: -Find the recruiter by searching "Talent Acquisition Recruiter at [Company]" or "Campus Recruiting Specialist at [Company]," and add the location of the internship. Send them a quick linkedin message asking them for their email. Once you have their email ask them to give you more information about the internship. Many are willing to meet up with you through Zoom. -Tailor your resume according to the internship. When I applied to a BIG4 compared to a financial/banking services company, I completely changed and organized my work experience to fit the description. I also examined their values and the profiles of other interns to get an idea of what they were looking for in a candidate to see what skills I needed to highlight. -Talk to senior students in your class and ask them about their internship experiences. They know the recruiters and whom to contact, so reach out to them. Utilizing your network will help you significantly. By following these steps, I was able to secure multiple internship offers for my sophomore and junior year. A reminder that this process is very stressful and sometimes you just need luck on your side. Here is a picture of me meeting Deloitte's US CEO
